김경찬씨 와이프관련기사가 Toronto star에 실렸습니다. 기사 본문보기

English teacher locates venues for talented students Kristin Rushowy EDUCATION REPORTER They're artistic masters who are also trying to master the English language. Broken English Artists, a group of six immigrants, came together after one approached English-as-a-second-language teacher Barb Rosen last September, seeking help to exhibit her paintings. From there, Rosen took five others under her wing, including a classical singer, a paper-folding artist and an egg artist, and helped them find venues for their work. Ukrainian oboeist Georgiy Kastulin performed for shoppers at IKEA stores during the Christmas holidays; classical singer Cathy Kim, of South Korea, has given two concerts, at an Indigo bookstore and a church. The artists also demonstrate their craft for others in their English classes and are hosting a March break arts camp for kids next week. ``Many have lost their self-esteem and confidence - they don't know the language and feel they've lost part of their identity,'' Rosen said. ``When you come and do something in a new country, you feel good about it.'' Egg artist Anna Lee, who came to Canada in 1999, majored in crafts at university in South Korea. She turns chicken, emu, goose and duck eggs into decorative jewelry boxes, figurines and even picture frames. Her work is on display at the Toronto Reference Library until April 12.
post.title: Immigrant artists find a voice for their work
